probably heard about the us-led

state but what exactly is it this

beginning
president obama announced the formation
of this current coalition against
Islamic state back in September 2014 and
they're actually over sixty countries on
board although their contributions and
their active participation vary hugely
so what exactly are all these countries
doing the United States and Iraq
apparently lead in the task of
supporting military operations so-called
capacity building and training the

exposing is his true nature basically

who is actually fighting against is well
in the lead no surprise is the world's
dominant military superpower and that's
the United States next largest is France
particularly since the Paris attacks and
the United Kingdom has extended British
airstrikes from Iraq into Syria as well
these three have one big thing in common
all those countries are among the
permanent veto powers on the United

matters because it means they feel a

plate the other really important

states including many key Arab countries
their reasons for taking part vary but
here are some common threads one they're
all allies of the United States two they
all have governments dominated by Sunni
Muslims and they see the non is Sunni
Muslims in both Iraq and Syria as
oppressed minorities
above all they're opposed to President
Assad and his regime in Syria and
opposed to the military financial and

Muslim Iran the dominant regional

now but are their roles somehow set in
stone
certainly not take the Gulf Arab powers
who helped build up this coalition in
2014 they've apparently reduced their
roles and stopped flying bombing
missions against is their new priority
is to help the Saudis in their fight in

largely because those rebels are seen as

it's the dominant regional challenger to
Saudis now let's break this idea of a
coalition down even a bit further first
how do you even form one often is not
coalition's are formed by a dominant
power which needs support from friends
in a fight as much for political reasons
as military ones to demonstrate that
it's not acting purely in its own
interests as a sort of global bully well
the more allies you have the less that
charge can be made to stick and if
you're intervening in a region with
particular religious sensitivities then
you definitely want as many regional
powers to join you as possible so next
question where did the Russian

Russia effectively heads its own
coalition with Iran in particular a
problem for the us-led coalition is that
Moscow's aims are substantially
different any limited cooperation
between those rival coalition's is
largely focused on trying to avoid
shooting each other's aircraft down and
finally what about boots on the ground
well this is the Achilles heel a us-led
coalition might look invulnerable but
actually it's only unbeatable the skies
on the ground it's reliant on Syrian
opposition fighters but they're by no
means a single coherent force it's
estimated that could be as many as a
hundred separate fighting groups some of

extremism
other fighters allied to the coalition
include of course Kurdish Peshmerga
soldiers it doesn't directly command and
their aim is to overthrow President

territory in Iraq and only incidentally
to worry about is the missed extremists
so the coalition formed against Islamic
state has distinct vulnerabilities most
leaders concede this fight will take
many many years holding coalition's

hardest task of all
